titleInfo.title: Letter from William Andrew Price, Agent for Affairs of the British Nation in the Gulf of Persia, to Benjamin Jervis, East India Company Resident at Bushire

mods.abstract: The letter is the official appointment of Jervis as the first resident of the new factory at Bushire. It covers various subjects including the articles of agreement signed with Shaik Saddoon [Sheikh Sa‘dūn], details of goods and men landed at Bushire, the levies and duties to be imposed and paid, the appointment of a Shroff (money changer) and linguist (Stephen Hermit), the need to procure musters of woollens imported to north Persia by the Russians, the need for frugality, and the opinion that Carem Caun's [Karim Khan] rule is both just and moderate.
